Sentencas: This study deals with an investigation of the direct oxidation of organic fuels with different molecular weights in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: It aims to demonstrate that the final products of the oxidation process are essentially CO2 and water with a very low amount of secondary products.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: An anodic catalyst formulation characterized by mixed electronic-ionic conductivity (MIEC) in combination with ceria electrolyte was used for this purpose.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: The anodic catalyst consisted in a composite Ni-modified perovskite mixed with Ce0.9Gd0.1O2.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: It provided reasonable fuel flexibility in SOFCs.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: To get insight into the reaction mechanism, the same anode formulation was investigated in an ex-situ autothermal reforming test.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: The performances achieved with the direct utilization of both gaseous and liquid fuels appear promising for SOFC applications in remote and micro-distributed energy generation as well as for portable power sources.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology

Sentencas: The anode layer demonstrated stable performance with very low amount of carbon deposition during more than 130 h testing under a direct utilization mode of dry organic fuels.
Titulo: Fuel flexibility: A key challenge for SOFC technology
